Package model

Class ToDoModel

java.lang.Object
model.ToDoModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class ToDoModel
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
This class implements Serializable for saving and compiles all the lists that have been created by the user. Calls methods on whatever ToDo list is currently being used and allows for changing lists and communicates to the list class to change the tasks attributes.
Author:
Henry Do, Gerry Guardiola, Mauricio Brooks, Xin Li
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    ToDoModel()
    Creates a List of ToDoLists that has only one ToDoList with no Tasks.

  • Constructor Details

    • ToDoModel

      public ToDoModel()
      Creates a List of ToDoLists that has only one ToDoList with no Tasks.

  • Method Details

    • changeColor

      public void changeColor​(java.lang.String color)
      Changes the currentList color to the specified color.
      Parameters:
      color - The color the list is changing to.

    • addList

      public void addList​(java.lang.String name)
      Adds a new empty list to the list of lists. The view will be automatically added to this new list provided that the addObserver method was used at least once before the calling of this method.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the new ToDoList.

    • deleteList

      public void deleteList()
      Deletes the current list. This method does not check to make sure that there is more than 1 list to be deleted. That is the responsibility of whatever called this to check to ensure that it is fine to delete.

    • nextList

      public void nextList()
      Iterates to the next list. Will loop back to the start if there is no next list.

    • prevList

      public void prevList()
      Iterates to the previous list. Will loop to the end of the lists if this function is called when the curList is the first list.

    • moreThanOneList

      public boolean moreThanOneList()
      Returns:
      True if the model holds more than one list currently.

    • renameList

      public void renameList​(java.lang.String name)
      Renames the current list to the given name and then notifies the view that the list has been renamed.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name of the list.

    • renameTask

      public void renameTask​(java.lang.String name, int pos)
      Renames the current task to the given name and then notifies the view that the list has been renamed.
      Parameters:
      name - The new name of the task.
      pos - The index of the task being updated.

    • addTask

      public void addTask​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String description, java.lang.String deadline, java.lang.String importance, java.lang.String location)
      Adds a new task with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the task.
      description - The description/notes about the task.
      deadline - The deadline for the task.
      importance - Indication of whether the task is important or not.
      location - The location of the task.

    • removeTask

      public void removeTask​(int index)
      Removes the task at the given index.
      Parameters:
      index - The task's index.

    • addObserver

      public void addObserver​(java.util.Observer view)
      Adds an Observer to all of the lists held in the model. Will also store the Observer so that this model can add this Observer to any newly created lists.
      Parameters:
      view - The Observer.

    • saveLists

      public void saveLists() throws java.io.IOException
      Saves this controller which houses all the lists for the ToDo lists in the file save.dat
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Means that the file was not able to be written to.

    • loadView

      public void loadView()
      Loads the current List.

    • changeImportance

      public void changeImportance​(java.lang.String importance, int curr)
      Changes the task at the position curr's completion status.
      Parameters:
      importance - The new task importance status.
      curr - The index of the task to have their importance status changed.

    • changeCompletion

      public void changeCompletion​(boolean complete, int curr)
      Changes the task at the position curr's completion status.
      Parameters:
      complete - The new task completion status.
      curr - The index of the task to have their completion status changed.

    • sort

      public void sort​(java.lang.String sortBy)
      Sorts the current list by the given sorting. Possible ways that the list can be sorted by: Name, Deadline, Importance, Create Time, Custom
      Parameters:
      sortBy - The given sorting as String.

    • hideCompletedTask

      public void hideCompletedTask()
      Gets current list and then hides the completed tasks in that list

    • showCompletedTask

      public void showCompletedTask()
      Gets current list and then shows the completed tasks in that list

    • moveUp

      public void moveUp​(int pos)
      Gets current list and based on the index given adjusts the position of that task in the list.
      Parameters:
      pos - Integer index of the current task.

    • moveTop

      public void moveTop​(int pos)
      Gets current list and based on the index given adjusts the position of that task in the list.
      Parameters:
      pos - Integer index of the current task.

    • getNameList

      public java.lang.String getNameList()
      Gets the String name of the current list to assist in JUnit testing.
      Returns:
      String name of the current list.
